question_text: Two angles are vertical angles. If one measures 75°, what is the measure of the other?
explanation: Vertical angles are always equal. If one is 75°, the other is also 75°.

question_text: Two angles form a linear pair. One measures 3x and the other measures 2x. What is the value of x?
explanation: Linear pairs are supplementary (sum to 180°). 3x + 2x = 180. 5x = 180. x = 36.

question_text: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. An alternate interior angle measures (4x - 10)° and its pair measures (3x + 20)°. What is x?
explanation: Alternate interior angles are equal. 4x - 10 = 3x + 20. Subtract 3x: x - 10 = 20. Add 10: x = 30.
